32622865.review:
[h1]"Prop Hunt"ın yeniden yorumlanmış hali Witch It![/h1]

Öncelikle en kısa sürede Türkçe yerelleştirme desteğine sahip olacak oyun şu anda Mağaza Sayfası'nda Türkçe bir şekilde sizi ağırlıyor. Tüm sorularınızın cevabını şu anda Erken Erişim sekmesinin altından bulabilirsiniz.

Witch It köylü ve cadı arasında geçen rekabeti tema edinmiş bir saklambaç oyunudur. Witch It'i diğer türdeş oyunlardan ayıran en basit özelliği ise görünümünün oldukça sevimli olması. Oyunu oynadığınızda çok rahat bir şekilde fark edeceksiniz.

Bir diğer hoş özelliği ise geliştiricilerin oyuna eklemiş olduğu Easter-Egg denen saklı özel eşyalar. Çoğu Witch It topluluğu tarafından bulunmuş olsa da hâlâ gizemini koruyan eşyalar olduğu söyleniyor.
Oyunda kılığına girebileceğiniz çok miktarda eşya bulunuyor. Bazı özel eşyalar ile etkileşime geçebiliyorsunuz (örn. mum, şamdan, gramafon, vb...)

Oyunda şu anda 5 harita bulunmakta:

[b][list]
    [*]Snowbreeze
    [*]The Cummy Potato
    [*]Gunewald Library / @ Night
    [*]Morgenstund
    [*]Fiskersted
[/b]

  ve daha fazlası yolda. Çoğu haritada bulunan gizemli hava oyuna hoş bir çevre sağlıyor. Haritaların boyutunun çok büyük olması işleri biraz zorlaştırıyor fakat belli bir süre sonra en spesifik noktaları öğreneceğiniz için işiniz daha kolaylaşıyor.

Ayrıca Witch It, takas kartı, başarım sistemi, envanter desteği de bulunduruyor. Team Fortress 2 oynayanların da hoşuna gidebilecek sistem olan Eşya Düşürme sistemi Witch It'de de bulunuyor. Yakıdna eklenecek pazar desteği ile eşya satımı da aktif olacak.

Seviye sistemi de bulunduran oyun her seviyede farklı yetenek ve eşya ile ödüllendiriyor. Şu anda her iki takım içinde 3 yetenek bulunuyor fakat erken erişim safhasında olan oyun yakında daha fazla oyun-içi ve Steam desteği ile güncellenecek.

Şu anda sadece İngilizce ve Almanca oyun-içi desteği bulunduran Witch It, çok yakın bir zamanda Türkçe dil desteğine de kavuşacak. Geliştiricilerin Türkçe Erken Erişim notları için Mağaza Sayfasını ziyaret edebilirsiniz.

Ayrıca geliştiriciler ile eş zamanlı irtibata geçebilmek ve diğer oyuncular ile etkileşime girebilmek için Discord sunucusunu da ziyaret edebilirsiniz. https://discord.gg/awaW5Q8

İyi eğlenceler.

32601461.review:
If you've ever played PropHunt Garry's Mod, then this game will not be anything crazy new to you. It's basically that, but improved upon dramatically.
Every round you play as either a stereotypical looking witch that shapeshifts into pretty much whatever object they want to, and tries to blend in and not get caught for a set duration of time. Or you play as a fat hunter that hucks potatoes at things that seem suspicious and out of the ordinary. That's the game put simply. 

While the game is still working out some kinks and adding things, I think at this stage it is well worth full price. 
The only thing I would add to that is if you plan on playing, it is much better done with a couple of friends in some kind of voice chat. That makes it all the more fun. 


You unlock customizations for your characters, which can be some hats or clothes, to things like changing your weapons to something outrageous like pizza.
There are a good chunks of maps currently in the game, and the objects on the map, from what I understand, are more or less randomized each time. So you can't just memorize where something is supposed to be and win consistently with knowledge like that. 
Hunters and Witches in this game each have their own set of unique abilities, at the moment only three each. Some are far better than others. They do need some fine tweaking, but all in all they're pretty decent as they are. 
My only real complaint is that the hunters can be punished very heavily if they are unfortunate enough to not have the hook ability(it lets you climb stuff essentially). As witches can fly, with the default ability. This means they can get up to some pretty high places that you might not be able to access just because you haven't unlocked/chosen the hook. Which I understand, because it's all about strategizing. But in most cases it's not viable if you are a lone hunter or something like that. 

The best thing as of now, is that the devs for the game are constantly open to suggestions from the community and are more than ready to communicate with them if there are questions. 
Also you can't buy four packs for the game because of steam, not the devs. It's annoying, but doesn't seem to be their fault.

So all in all, if you have some friends you can convince to get the game with you, you'll get your moneys worth in hours and hours of fun.

A great game to play when you want to chill out a bit and have a good laugh.

32595771.review: Witch It is a Hide and Seek game from the developer Barrel Roll Games, the team's first independent Steam release. Witch It's gameplay takes from Prop Hunt's mechanics, but adds more features such as two separate game modes, character customization and abilities. The game itself looks very polished, and I really like the pixel art aesthetic it has. From the 20+ hours I've put into this game, I've had a lot of fun with it on my own. None of my friends have picked up the game yet, but there is also a great community as well that you can talk, play, and trade with. For some, the price might be a little too much for some for what the game currently has to offer, but the developers are continuously adding more and more to the game, so the price shouldn't be an issue soon. Witch It is a great, fun, and casual game that is enjoyable alone and with friends.

32547693.review:
[b]As a brief note before I start: I am the Community Manager of Witch It - however, my position is voluntary and this review speaks entirely from heart; these are my genuine, honest opinions![/b]

[h1]What is Witch It?[/h1]

Witch It is an online hide & seek style game, or as some call it; "Prop hunt - done right". For those who don't know what prop hunt is, think of hide & seek where the hiders (in this case, the Witches) have to blend into the environment by mimicking any object in the world that isn't bolted down, while the seekers (the Hunters) have to search for them and destroy them. You may be familiar with this gamemode from Garry's Mod; however, Witch It aims to provide a completely new approach to this genre.

In Witch It, you will first drop down into one of the 7 maps (with more to come), each with its own playstyle and variety of prop layouts - for example, 'Grunewald Library' is a gigantic library map with lots of indoor and outdoor areas to hide and blend in with, while 'Fiskersted' is based on a small frozen lake where creativity in picking your spot is very important in surviving for long! Choosing your playstyle is crucial; some maps require the Witches to be on their feet and adapt to certain situations, while others encourage patience so the Hunters don't catch you moving - it's very fun finding out what playstyle suits you best for different situations!

After you join a map, you are first put into one of the two teams; Hunters or Witches. Each team has its own unique set of skills that you can select and unlock, each with its own benefits and counters. For example, Hunters have a skill that allows them to throw a chicken that alarms the player when there is a prop present in a nearby radius, while Witches have a flying ability that allows them to reach tougher spots and escape from Hunters quickly! Eventually, you will be finding yourself unlocking skills that invert the Hunters controls or prevents the Witches from using their magic; it's an enjoyable, fresh feeling to gameplay that is satisfying for any style of gamer, whether you are familiar with prop hunt gameplay or not.

Witch It also boasts a diverse set of customisable items that are unlocked by playing the game; Loot up your Hunters and Witches with funky hats, attractive brooms, and even throwable pizza! Each player can rock their own unique identity over time from just playing the game and levelling up; though there are plans for releasing exclusive content to competition winners and content creators alike!

[h1]✔ Current Features[/h1]

✔ 9 playable maps featuring a variety of prop layouts to keep you engaged for hours!
✔ An expanding set of unique skills for both Witches/Hunters!
✔ Dynamic prop movement and easy-to-use controls!
✔ Countless customization items for your characters, in a variety of rarities!
✔ Steam Inventory & Trading support!
✔ Dedicated and player-hosted servers!
✔ Account levelling and progression!
✔ Active and incredibly engaging developers (BarrelRollGames) who play and chat with the community daily; they even work weekends to bring us new and exciting content!

[h1]↕ Upcoming Features & Improvements[/h1]

↕ More content; new maps, new props, new customisables, new skills, new rarities, and much more!
↕ New gamemodes, such as gamemodes where you are allocated a random prop;
↕ Mutators/host settings for servers to allow for all types of gameplay; including a no-skill mode for traditional prop hunt players;
↕ Twitch/Discord Integration;
↕ In-game music;
↕ Events with limited-edition items;
↕ Balancing, including changes to current and upcoming skills;
↕ UE4 Crash Fixes;
↕ More regions for dedicated servers;
↕ Mac/Linux Support;
+ Other surprises we don't know about!

[h1]FAQ:[/h1]

[b]Do I need friends to play with to enjoy the game?[/b]
Witch It is definitely the most fun with a group of friends connected together through a voice chat program such as Discord, but it is not necessary to play with people you know - there are countless servers with new people to meet, and there are plenty of people looking to play on the [url=https://discord.gg/2h3FH3Z]Official Witch It Discord Server[/url], so it's definitely worth popping in and saying hi!

[i]Note: 4-packs for Steam are discontinued with new game releases.[/i]

[b]Is Witch It going to be stuck in Early Access hell?[/b]
Absolutely not! The developers are set for a full release nearer to the end of this year, and plan on working on more content and updates even after release!

[b]Can my computer run it?[/b]
You can find the minimum system requirements near the bottom of the [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/559650/Witch_It/]Witch It Store Page[/url], though if your computer hits the requirements and you are still having issues you can always contact the developers in our Discord server!

[h1]Useful Links:[/h1]

[b]Witch It Discord:[/b]
https://discord.gg/2h3FH3Z

[b]Developer Twitter:[/b]
https://twitter.com/BarrelRollDev

[b]Community (Support) Twitter[/b]
https://twitter.com/WitchItGame


[i]Thank you for reading and don't forget to review Witch It yourself if you decide to give it a shot![/i]

32533388.review:
it's a good game, a damned good game. the catchphrase "prop hunt done right" has stuck to it because, well, it's an accurate description, and the devs are active in the community. the price is also really good.

there are numerous maps, and there are more playmodes being developed. definite win. about the only negative to the game is the fact that there aren't any dedicated servers in Australia yet, but there are plans for that to change, and considering the size of the dev team and budget that they have, that's completely understandable. as you can see from the pictures at the top of the page, it's a very cartoonish style, and for a prop hunt style game, that's ideal.

EDIT - there are now Australian servers for the game.

it's not the lightest on resources, you'll need a fairly heavy GPU to be able to play it at 1080p60fps on ultra settings, but that's because of the fantastic Unreal Engine 4 that the game uses. with the settings turned down low it's playable on a laptop from a few years ago. another thing is that at the moment it doesn't support 32bit systems and will only work in a 64bit environment, but that's also an issue with UE4 and it's memory usage rather than the game, and the devs are working hard to fix it.

this review has been written less than a month after the game was launched in Early Access, so the negative points of this review might well have been fixed by the time you get to buy the game.

oh yeah, the community is also fantastic, there aren't too many toxic players yet, and the devs are also working on systems that will keep things nice and friendly.

see you in on the hunt!

32517526.review:
Witch It - aus dem Hause Barrel Roll Games - ein bezaubernder Spaß für Groß und Klein.  

Wer hat nicht in seiner Kindheit gern mal Räuber und Gendarm gespielt. 
Sich in die engsten Lücken beim Verstecken gepresst oder aus seiner Anhöhung einen Lachanfall bekommen, wenn der Suchende verzweifelt seine Haare rauft. 

Das Prinzip von Witch It knüpft genau hier an.
Als Hexe heißt es sich in einen "Prop" - ergo einen Gegenstand zu verwandeln und schnellst möglichst so "natürlich" wie möglich zu wirken. 
Während hingegen die Jäger mit Kartoffel, Mistgabel und Hühner bewaffnet sich auf die Jagd nach den Grünhäutern begeben. 

Witch It bietet ein unheimlich hohen Suchtfaktor. 
Die Möglichkeit sogar dank dem Discord-Server der Devs - mit jenen direkt in Verbindung zu treten und dort FeedBack, Bugs, Tipps und Hilfe zu erhalten. 
Ein schnelles "in das Spiel rein kommen" 
Spannende und witzige Erlebnise - ohne das man lange Wartet. 
Wobei selbst das - auf die nächste Runde warten, einem schon viel Spaß bereiten kann. 

Aktuell gibt es zwei verschiedene Spielmodi.

Mobification
Hide and Seek

Das klassiche Hide and Seek werden wohl die meisten Spieler irgendwoher kennen.

Eine Anzahl von x Spielern (bis zu 16 pro Server).
Je nach Einstellung werden dann entweder Zufällig eine Anzahl von diesen Spielern als Jäger ausgewählt oder die Spieler wählen frei welchem Team sie angehören. (Je nach Server-Einstellung)

Die Hexen starten mit einer "Versteckphase" - kurz darauf beginnen die Jäger jene Hexen zu suchen.
Wird eine Hexe von einem Jäger gefunden und ausgeschaltet (Nahkampf oder Fernkampf), so wird die Hexe zum Zuschauer.
Sind alle Hexen in der vorgegebenen Suchzeit gefunden - so gewinnen die Jäger.
Andernfalls gewinnen die Hexen.

So oder so, egal wer gewinnt - hier steht defintiv der Spaß im Vordergrund. 

Mobification ist ähnlich dem Classic Mode Hide and Seek - der große Unterschied hierbei ist nur, dass die besiegte Hexe nun ebenfalls zum Jäger. 
Hier wird es also mit der Zeit schnell voll mit Jägern. 

Es ist immer wieder ein kleiner Adrenalin schock, wenn man als Buch im Regal steht und ein Jäger knapp an einem Vorbei wirft oder gar neben einem stehen bleibt und überlegt was man macht. 

Erwähnenswert wären auch noch die witzigen, unterschiedlichen Fähigkeiten - aber ich denke .... darüber red' ich hier jetzt nicht, die gilt es einfach selbst zu testen. 
Das heißt, hier wäre dann jetzt auch der Zeitpunkt, dass Spiel in den Warenkorb zu legen und den Kauf zu finalisieren. 

Auf das man sich bald in Witch It sucht!

Quanti di voi da piccoli hanno passato ore e ore di puro divertimento con i propri amici a giocare a nascondino? E quanti di voi sognavano un bel gioco dove ritrovare questo passatempo? Purtroppo, però, a nostro parere questo gioco non riesce a far rivivere le emozioni dell'originale nascondino. Il titolo semplicemente annoia dopo due partite, e non riesce a regalare le emozioni che si ripromette di donare al giocatore.

32487897.review:
By far the best prop hunt game I've played. Witch It! makes boths the witch and hunter fun and exciting. As a hunter, finding a prop and having to chase them down is amazing. And when you're the witch watching hunters pass by you is a tense, wonderful, feeling, even if scary moment. Most other prop hunt games make playing a hunter/chaser boring and makes me feel like quiting, but Witch It! avoids that by adding in cool skills like the chicken to help keep you going.
     Witch It! is also a great game to play with friends. If you're both witches, you can hide out together or try to get each other killed. Or as hunters, divide and conquer all the witches as an epic team, and compete to see who's the better hunter. And if you don't have any friends to play with, Witch It! has an amazing community that won't leave you hanging.
     One of my best buys, I recommend Witch It! to anyone who wants to have some good laughs and nice friends.

Le concept est repris du « Prop Hunt » de Garry's Mod, mais est largement amélioré et travaillé. Le jeu possède son propre univers graphique et est très agréable à l'oeil. Le nombre d'objets disponible est varié, les maps sont bien pensées et il existe une multitude de cachettes ultra secrètes. 32264506.review:
Witch It is a prop hunt-inspired game created by a small group of developers and is currently in its Early Access stage.

When writing my review for this game, I will be judging on if the game is fun or not; regardless of it being Early Access or not.

[h1]The Gameplay[/h1]

In terms of being a game inspired by prop hunt, Barrel Roll's [i]Witch it[/i] hits a lot of nails on the head. The controls are very intuitive and easy to understand, and during my 10 hours of playing the game I never thought "Huh, why is this the way it is?". I feel as if this was because in terms of making a prop hunt game, the only real things that you need to put in are self-explanatory: Let the hiders be a prop, let seekers find them. Very simple

Something that distinguishes Witch It from prop hunt however, is the various abilities that both hiders, which I will refer to as Witches from now on, and seekers, which I will refer to as Villagers, possess. The starting abilities that both teams get are very useful, and do a good job at not making a new player feel as if they will have less of a chance than someone else with an ability that they haven't unlocked yet.

One quirk that I have found with the abilities however lay with the Witches abilities'. The starting ability makes the most sense: It allows the Witch to levitate so they can find better hiding spots. The rest feel somewhat rushed and underpowered compared to the leviation ability though. For instance, one unlockable ability allows the Witch to create a copy of themself and potentially confuse Villagers. While this is certainly a neat ability that could be used for shenanigans with friends, it is significantly underpowered compared to levitating, especially on maps where being a prop on the ground is suicide.

As of right now there are 3 abilities per team, with the promise of more being added in later patches.

Another thing worth noting is that despite this game being Early Access, I did not find any bug directly related to gameplay. Never once did I get stuck in a wall, glitch through the skybox, or discover a game-breaking spot.


[h1]The Art[/h1]

Witch It went with a cartoony artstyle set in a world rich with mystery and magic. I personally feel like this was the optimal choice considering what the team had to work with. Despite the pixelated models, the maps and general art of the game was pleasing to the eye and beautiful to look at. 

Any game that can make me excited for new maps simply because I am curious as to what they look like is sure to have a great artstyle.

The maps as well all felt very well-rounded and a joy to explore. With the exception of some that offered little prop-choice. (Some maps offered a huge selection of props despite them not being as large as others. Some, mainly the two snow-themed maps, offer less selection and you will mostly likely have to go with finding a small prop and waiting it out in a secluded area.)

[h1] UI, and Behind the Curtain[/h1]

The UI of Witch It is minimal, and this actually works in the game's favour. It displays the information that the player should know, such as health, magic, prop name, and avoids cluttering the UI with unnecessary information. 

(One thing that I really want to mention is the little bubbling sound effect that the XP bar has when adding experience points is the sole reason for at least 2 extra rating points. I love it, never change it.)

Now in terms of whats going on behind the curtain, Witch It is blessed to have a dedicated team of developers who are actively engaging in the community. (Seriously, if you want to be a part of the Witch It community, just join their Discord).

They have an active channel devoted to giving players a chance to submit their game ideas. Even if not all ideas can make it into the game, it really shows that the devs care for the game and its community.


[h1] Pros & Cons [/h1]

Pros:
-Pleasant graphics
-A breath of fresh air from the drab shooters and other generic titles
-Fun to play with friends!
-The developer team is actively engaging with the community, which is always heartwarming to see.
-Plenty of variety in the maps and props. You won't have the same type of game twice in a row.
-The community of the game is friendly. I've yet to run into a toxic player who ruined my experience.
-Cool abilities that add a unique flair to the game.
-The awesome lil bubbly sound! (I mean it, devs. Never change this; I'll hurt you.)
-Nice UI
-Even when playing solo, I had a blast!
-Promise of extra maps, abilities, and other features to be added in later patches.,

Cons:
-Models are pixelated
-Some users have reported optimization problems. (With my budget gaming build I can run the game on max just fine)
-Some maps would benefit from adding a bit more props.
-Witch spells should be a bit more balanced to give players a reason to try other spells than levitation.

???:
-Male jiggle physics

TL;DR Witch It is fun regardless if you're playing with friends or not. I would absolutely recommend this game if you have played a prop hunt game in the past, or have ever wanted to try one, Witch It is definitely worth picking up. I will definitely continue to play and enjoy this game.

32221417.review:
Was ist Witch it!? Im Kern handelt es sich um ein klassisches Versteckspiel...mit dem Unterschied, dass man sich hier nicht in, auf oder hinter Gegenständen verstecken, sondern sich direkt in diese verwandeln kann. Zumindest als Hexe. Ihr wollt ein Holzkrug sein? Oder vielleicht ein...Stuhl? Oder doch besser eine Kerze? Alles kein Problem. Solange eine Sache beweglich ist (also bspw. keine Häuser), kann man sich in diese "transformieren". Noch lustiger ist es, dass man sich selbst in diesen Formen noch weiter bewegen kann. Ich finde es immer wieder großartig, wenn ich eine der anderen Hexen bspw. als Kissen "verkleidet" über den Boden "schubbern" sehe. Doch solche Aktionen sind mit Vorsicht zu genießen, denn auf der anderen Seite stehen die Jäger mit ihrem fetten Wanst. Ihre Aufgabe ist es, die Hexen zu finden, mit Dreckklumpen abzuwerfen und letztlich zu töten (allerdings absolut familienfreundlich). Die Lebensenergie der Zauberdamen richtet sich dabei nach dem Gegenstand, in den sie sich verwandelt haben. So hält man als Apfel bspw. deutlich weniger aus, als wenn man sich in einen Heuballen transformiert. Aber das ist eigentlich nur fair, weil man als letztgenannter Gegenstand ja auch deutlich einfacher zu treffen ist. Stellt sich jetzt nur die Frage, wie die Jäger denn die Hexen finden sollen, wenn diese sich in jeden Gegenstand verwandeln können? Dafür stehen ihnen unterschiedliche Hilfsmittel zur Verfügung. Für mich hat sich dabei das Huhn mit seinen ausgeprägten Sinnen als sehr hilfreich und praktikabel erwiesen. Ja, ihr habt richtig gelesen: Ein Huhn. Dieses wirft man einfach irgendwo hin und wenn es sich in der Nähe einer Zauberin befindet, schlägt es aus (was anhand eines Kreises um das Tierchen zu sehen ist). Wenn die Hexe ganz besonders nah ist, erscheint über dem Kerlchen ein Ausrufezeichen. Nun gilt es, alle nahe gelegenen Gegenstände abzuwerfen und darauf zu warten, dass einer von ihnen zu schreien anfängt und wegzu...rollen versucht;) Wenn man Pech hat, muss man ein paar Sekunden warten, bis ein neues Huhn zur Verfügung steht. Alternativ kann der Jäger (neben einer 3. Fähigkeit, die ich allerdings noch nicht freischalten konnte) auch ein Wurfhaken nutzen, um sich sich auf die Dächer der Häuser zu ziehen. Aber warum sollte man das tun? Naja, die Hexen haben auch so ihre Spezialfähigkeiten. Eine davon ermöglicht es ihnen, für eine kurze Zeit zu fliegen (auch im verwandelten Zustand), sodass sie sich sehr gut in kleinen Ecken zwischen den Dachgiebeln verstecken können. Alternativ lässt sich eine "Fake Hexe" herbeizaubern und lenken, in der Hoffnung, dass die Jäger darauf anspringen und dem "Double" hinterherrennen. Auch die Magierinnen haben noch eine 3. Fähigkeit, die ich jedoch ebenfalls noch nicht kenne. 

Das zum groben Ablauf. Versüßt wird einem all dies mit freischaltbaren Verkleidungen, 5 richtig schönen Maps, einer lustigen Soundkulisse und stabilen Servern, auf denen man aktuell auch immer Mitspieler findet. Das Game selbst läuft zwar selbst auf meinem recht potenten Gaminglaptop (G751JY mit 24GB RAM, einer 980m und einem i7 4710HQ) noch nicht so ganz flüssig, aber wenn man die Einstellungen etwas nachjustiert, flutscht es gut (50-60 FPS) und macht wirklich Spaß. 

Einzig eine Musikuntermalung würde ich mir noch wünschen. Wie ich mittlerweile erfahren habe, wurde von den Entwicklern zwar kürzlich Musik in das Main menu eingefügt, aber auch innerhalb der Runden wäre das wünschenswert. Naja, solange das noch fehlt, habe ich nebenbei meine eigene Musik laufen;) 

Schlussendlich möchte ich noch die Discordgruppe lobend erwähnen. Hier lassen sich Bugs melden, Verbesserungsvorschläge einreichen, Mitspieler finden und man erhält aktuelle Neuigkeiten zu Updates etc. 

Insofern gibt es für mich an Witch it! nahezu nichts zu meckern und für einen EA-Titel läuft es wirklich klasse. Ich hätte nicht gedacht, dass ich als Erwachsener nochmal so viel Gefallen am Verstecken finden würde;) 

Wer sich gerne etwa 1 Stunde Gameplay (more to come) aus erster Hand anschauen möchte, darf gerne mal meinen Youtube-Kanal besuchen:) 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLk-Gd833IE-E0HYcr8xqG4clU8Etfoh94

32148023.review:
A better version of Prop Hunt.

Witch It is a team based multiplayer game with two character roles.

The Witch can transform into various physics objects in the environment such as tomatos, bowls or giant slices of cheese. 
The controls take a bit to get used to as you roll around the environment or try to hang onto a wall as a painting, but once you get the hang of it, it's a lot of fun!

The Hunter searches out and destroys Witches by attacking the "prop" items in the environment with long range shots (that can overheat if spammed), or a melee attack.

Each side has different abilities you can unlock.

Witches start with levitation, allowing you to fly for a short period.
Unlocks include an ability to right click and control a mimic witch who walks where your mouse cursor is..
or a poison spore that drops on the ground and any hunters caught in the blast will have their movement / mouse controls reversed. After playing for a while, I find the spore more annoying than fun. I'd like to see it changed to a smoke bomb or something because with how laggy some servers get, inverted controls is a bit over powered.

Hunters on the other hand start with a chicken throw ability. The chicken will tumble around and start screaming at you if a nearby prop is a witch.
Unlocks include a grappling hook which allows you to pull yourself to walls, roof tops and even props! In a lot of ways this ability is required as some maps have areas witches can hide that you can't access without the hookshot (or at least it's very difficult without one)..
The final ability lets you throw garlic / an onion which will cancel any witch ability who is in the area. This ability can also stick to props / witches.

Now that we've got that outta the way, let's talk about how many maps you get for the price. 
2 snow maps (one of which isn't particularly fun), the snow moves as you walk in it which is very cool and can help you find hiding props. 
2 vibrant green maps, one of which is a mansion with a hedge maze outside. 
2 night maps (one is just a night version of the mansion map but doesn't let you go outside).
More maps are planned, so hopefully it won't take too long to see more and hopefully the game will some day support custom maps with steam workshop.

FINAL THOUGHTS:
If you've ever played Gmod Prop Hunt, you'll feel right at home with Witch It. 
The props have a few different sets they can cycle through on each map, so you won't always see a pumpkin spawn in the same place each round and holding SHIFT as a prop allows you to adjust yourself based on where your mouse is looking, giving you a lot of control for hiding.
It's good fun playing online with strangers, but having a bunch of friends to scream at in a custom game is where the real fun is had as you drop down hints to finding each other. Definitely worth the asking price!

32145904.review: I can honestly say this is the Prop Hunt I wanted to play so many years ago.  It's been streamlined, bugfixed, and tweaked to the point of having some really interesting, arcade-y gameplay.  No team feels dominant, no playstyle feels overpowered - there's no glitched out hideyholes and no abusable loopholes.  If you had even a passing interest in the GMod gamemode, please play Witch It.

32141590.review:
[b] O jogo é basicamente um prop hunt (Garry's Mod) com bastante customização cosmética e algumas habilidades. [/b]

[h1] Pra quem não conhece: [/h1]

Como bruxa, seu objetivo é sobreviver. Sua habilidade principal é poder se disfarçar de QUALQUER objeto no mapa a qualquer momento, inlcusive se já estiver disfarçado. Ao evoluir de level, você libera algumas habilidades como criar um clone, flutuar por alguns segundos ou desorientar os caçadores. Fora os itens de customização

Como caçador, seu objetivo é encontrar e matar as bruxas. Simples, não? Definitivamente não. O caçador possui uma galinha que mostra se existe alguma bruxa em um raio de 6m de onde ela foi jogada. Isso facilita bastante na hora de procurar, mas mesmo assim ainda não é fácil assim. O caçador possui como habilidades a galinha, um gancho para se locomover para lugares altos, e uma armadilha anti-magia, que bloqueia todo tipo de magia das bruxas.

Há uma quantidade significativa de jogadores ativos e mapas disponíveis. A física de cada objeto é diferente no jogo.

Comprei o jogo para testar e acabei me divertindo mais do que imaginei.

Recomendado!

[h1] **Por ser um jogo de Early Access, esperem alguns bugs e mudança de ping constantes** [/h1]

32115934.review:
I played this game in the beta and just bought it when it came out yesterday. Love the graphics/art style, and It's a lot of fun .. IF you can avoid cheaters.  

I didn't have any problems in most of the games I played but I started noticing that sometimes the hunter was finding everyone really quickly. In those games, there was always someone that was spectatiing in the game. 

You can join a game and not participate. You don't HAVE to play.  And when you are spectating, you can see where all the witches are hiding. I never saw anyone in the in-game chat telling where witches were hiding, but if you were using  a voice chat, like discord or something, with another low life cheater friend, then you could just take turns being the hunter while the spectator just tells you were everyone is hiding and rack up the points and level up. This is a problem.  

If it's not a mobification game-type, then It's nice to be able to spectate after you get killed so you can at least watch the gameplay but if the spectators can see where all the other witches are hiding then there is the potential for them to tell their friend(s) where they are if they're a pathetic cheating loser. Sadly, as long as there are video games, there will be losers trying to figure out a way to cheat so they can pretend they are awesome and such a high level with all the skills,etc.

Funny thing is, during the beta, if you were a witch, you could see the other witches (props) high-lighted if you were near them, but now you can't, so that helps keep people from helping friends cheat if they are participating in the game.  I don't know how to fix this ... maybe just make it where spectators can watch but not be able to see where the other witches (props) are hiding. 

Like I said , this a really fun game, and most of the games I have played I didn't have this issue, but it's really new and there is a lot of potential for the game to be ruined by low-life, cheating, false-glory vvh0res.  This should be addressed now if they want this game to be successful.

32114667.review:
Amazing game, loads of fun, terrifying and exciting. Probably the best $12 I've spent this year.

Certain things could use some work though. Hope to see some fixed on full release :) 

- You end up stuck in a lot of situations
- Holding "Left Shift" rights you, but does not always turn you in the "right" way, making it difficult to get proper positioning
- The server setting that allows witches to see each other's position needs to be auto-disabled on any map during "Mobification"

These are not complaints, just things I hope get looked into during development.

32107260.review:
Love it! Was eagerly waiting for the early access since I first tried it in december :)

Pros
- Very charming artstyle
- The sound effects are really good
- The ability to use randomized voiceclips at all times. A  group of hunters grunting at each other is hilarious!
- All the possibilities with different abilities
- Leveling up and unlocking more skins adds that little extra to the fun
- Runs smoothly and so far no server/connection issues
- Actively communicating developers
- Events with nice cosmetic items

Cons
- No music during gameplay at this time
- Steam achievements are only for each level up, some additions in the future would be nice

Overall, considering the game IS in early access, it's quite a finished game that keeps getting updated frequently <3

Классная игра жанра prop hunt, сказать иначе не могу.
Следил за ней, когда она еще была в дикой "альфе" и под названием Witch Hunt.
Даже при том, что была доступна всего одна карта, она приносила очень много эмоций.
С друзьями в нее играли постоянно, самые различные смешные моменты, лулзы приключались.

32101632.review: Had fun for hours non stop. Counters to each skill that other players can have, and full control over the facing of your prop. Best Prop Hunt game so far!

32100751.review:
I just love this game! 11.2hrs on record, but that's not counting the (+)100hrs I played in alpha and beta.

Sometimes you win by hiding in a really good spot as a prop that blends in, other times you get away with just being a big haystack in the middle of the map. Because who would be so dumb(/smart) to hide in plain sight.

Devs have done a great job with everything from balancing to map/customization design. They also got big focus on hearing the players feedback.
(F.ex. In beta, people complained a lot about hunters being able to spam everything, 2(?)days later a stamina system was in place for throwables. )

The best thing about this game? It's gotta be the voice taunts!
Nothing is more satisfying than a hunter that looks straight at you, but doesn't see you, and you spam 1 and 2 with witch laughs. Or you got a witch cornered as a hunter and start grunting right before you kill them.

[b]TL;DR:[/b]
Buy the game, bring a friend (or not) and join the fun!
Don't listen to people who say [i] blablabla, just another prop hunt game [/i]

32095451.review:
Very clean, looking and great controlling game.
This game is fun with friends and can be a good fun chill out game on your own.

I enjoy it a lot and if you like Prop Hunt on Minecraft, Call of Duty or Gmod then you should give this a go and you will defo get a few hours out of this. And more so if you have friends to play it with.

Pros:
- 16 players a game
- Nice overall art style and lighting effects
- Runs smooth and is very polished overall.
- Leveling system with Skin Unlocks and ability's. 
- 5 or so maps that all have unique props to turn into and cluttered spaces to hide in.

Cons:
- Currently I feel like the game is already full of people that just hide on tops of roof's or in the hardest to reach places to avoid being even walked past. Some sort of game rule to disable jumping/roof hiding may be interesting.
- Skins seem to drop very rarely and I am not sure how many skins there actually are to unlock.
- Only 2 unlockable Witch Perks and Only 1 for hunters. Though hopefully more will come!

The con's are not really cons, they are just personal opinion and and things that maybe some people may pick up on like I have myself.
